description: Comprehensive Well History Data for 7 Primary Wells in WellTegra Network

downholeEquipment.function: Primary safety barrier - automatic shut-in on control line pressure loss
downholeEquipment.lastTestResult: FAILED - Valve did not close on command

downholeEquipment.function: Isolate tubing-casing annulus and protect casing from reservoir pressure

downholeEquipment.description: Solid barium sulfate scale blockage preventing toolstring passage
downholeEquipment.scaleComposition: BaSO4 (>95%), with trace FeS and CaCO3

events.summary: Initial well completion with HPHT tubing, packer, TRSSV, and TCP perforating
Well brought online. Initial rate: 8,500 bopd condensate, 42 MMscfd gas
6-month TRSSV function test - valve cycled successfully
Annual pressure and temperature survey to 18,350 ft
events.keyFindings: Reservoir pressure declining as expected. No tubing restrictions noted.

events.summary: Multi-pass PLT survey to assess perforation contribution
events.keyFindings: 70% of production from upper 50ft of perforations. Lower perfs contributing minimally.

events.summary: Routine surveillance run - CRITICAL DISCOVERY: Cannot pass 8,500ft due to casing restriction
events.anomalyDetected: Hard stop at 8,500ft. Tools will not pass.
events.followUpAction: MFC (Multi-Finger Caliper) log ordered to diagnose restriction

events.summary: MFC log confirms severe casing ovalization at 8,500ft MD
events.keyFindings: Severe ovalization detected. Minimum ID reduced from 8.681" to 7.2". Caused by geomechanical stress from reservoir depletion.

events.summary: Attempted production test - well died after 6 hours of flow
events.keyFindings: Pressure analysis suggests deep blockage around 14,000-14,500 ft. Suspected BaSO4 scale bridge.

events.summary: 6-month TRSSV test - CRITICAL FAILURE: Valve did not close on command
events.anomalyDetected: TRSSV failed to close. Control line pressure response abnormal.
events.followUpAction: Well shut-in on surface tree (annulus valves). Production suspended until TRSSV repaired or replaced.

events.summary: Cross-functional team assembled to assess well integrity status
events.outcome: Decision: Well to remain shut-in pending comprehensive intervention plan
events.keyFindings: Three critical issues identified: (1) Casing deformation at 8,500ft, (2) Suspected scale blockage at 14,200ft, (3) Failed TRSSV at 2,500ft

events.summary: MoC approved for multi-stage intervention campaign
events.keyDetails: Authorized comprehensive intervention: expandable patch, scale removal, DHSV replacement

events.summary: Detailed engineering and planning for complex multi-stage intervention
keyActivities: Program development using WellTegra AI recommendations

fluidHistory.purpose: Displace drilling mud and provide hydrostatic overbalance during completion
Lighten fluid column prior to first production
Control well pressure during casing restriction investigation

testingHistory.acceptanceCriteria: Valve closes on control line pressure loss, no leakage
Valve closes on control line pressure loss, no leakage
Valve closes on control line pressure loss, no leakage
Valve closes on control line pressure loss, no leakage
testingHistory.failureMode: Valve did not close on control line bleed-down

testingHistory.acceptanceCriteria: Less than 10% pressure drop over 60 minutes

liveAnomalies.description: Severe ovalization of production casing at 8,500ft MD
liveAnomalies.remediationPlan: Install 60ft expandable steel patch across deformed section

liveAnomalies.description: BaSO4 scale bridge at approximately 14,200ft MD
liveAnomalies.remediationPlan: 48hr DTPA chemical soak followed by CT jetting

liveAnomalies.description: TRSSV failed to close during function test
liveAnomalies.remediationPlan: Lock open failed TRSSV and install wireline-retrievable insert valve

contingencyLog.contingencyAction: Pulled out of hole. Ordered MFC diagnostic log.
contingencyLog.outcome: Successfully recovered tools. MFC log confirmed casing deformation.

contingencyLog.contingencyAction: Shut-in well immediately. Conducted pressure analysis.
contingencyLog.outcome: Analysis revealed deep blockage. Well left shut-in pending intervention.

contingencyLog.issue: TRSSV failed to close on control line bleed-down
contingencyLog.contingencyAction: Immediate shut-in on surface tree valves. NSTA notified.
contingencyLog.outcome: Well secured using secondary barriers. Regulatory approval for continued shut-in received.

riskFactors.mitigation: Well shut-in on secondary barriers pending DHSV replacement
Expandable patch to restore full-bore access

wellIntegrityStatement.nonComplianceReason: Primary DHSV barrier failed function test

managementOfChangeLog.title: W666 Multi-Stage Intervention Campaign
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Primary safety barrier failure + casing deformation + scale blockage require comprehensive intervention
managementOfChangeLog.riskAssessment: HIGH - Complex multi-stage intervention in HPHT environment

mitigations: Certified HWU equipment with valid pressure testing
Lifting plan with certified crane operator

personnelAndCompetency.name: M. Thompson
personnelAndCompetency.involvement: Safety case development and JSA preparation

personnelAndCompetency.name: S. Williams
personnelAndCompetency.involvement: On-site supervision of all intervention operations

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Primary DHSV Barrier Failure - W666
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Notification of TRSSV failure during routine test. Well shut-in on secondary barriers.

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Intervention Program Submission - W666
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Submission of comprehensive intervention program for NSTA review and approval

deformationDetails.restrictionSeverity: Was unable to pass 2.313" OD tools - NOW RESTORED

downholeEquipment.function: Primary safety barrier - automatic shut-in on control line pressure loss

downholeEquipment.description: 60ft expandable steel patch installed to remediate casing ovalization

events.summary: Initial well completion
Well brought online. Initial rate: 5,200 bopd condensate, 28 MMscfd gas
CRITICAL DISCOVERY: Standard 2.313" OD toolstring unable to pass 8,500ft - hard stop encountered
events.anomalyDetected: Hard stop at 8,500ft. Casing restriction suspected.
events.followUpAction: MFC log ordered to diagnose restriction

events.summary: MFC log confirms severe casing ovalization at 8,500ft MD
events.keyFindings: Severe ovalization detected. Minimum ID reduced from 8.681" to 7.1". Geomechanical stress from reservoir depletion identified as cause.

events.summary: Pre-patch wellbore preparation - scraper run and gauge verification
events.keyFindings: Wellbore cleaned and ready for patch deployment

events.summary: SUCCESS: 60ft expandable steel patch installed across deformed section - full bore access restored
events.keyFindings: Patch successfully expanded and pressure tested to 10,000 psi. Full-bore ID restored to 8.5". Well access fully restored.

events.summary: Verification run confirms successful patch installation and full access
events.keyFindings: Toolstring passed through patched section without restriction. Production resumed.

events.summary: Well returned to production - production rates restored to pre-deformation levels
events.keyFindings: Production: 5,100 bopd, 27 MMscfd gas - full restoration achieved

testingHistory.acceptanceCriteria: Less than 5% pressure drop over 60 minutes

resolvedAnomalies.description: Severe ovalization of production casing at 8,500ft MD
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: Expandable patch is proven, rigless solution for casing deformation in this field

riskFactors.mitigation: Expandable patch successfully installed and tested

managementOfChangeLog.title: M-21 Expandable Patch Installation
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Casing deformation requires expandable patch to restore well access

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Expandable Patch Program Submission - M-21
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Submission of expandable patch program for NSTA review

downholeEquipment.description: Hard barium sulfate scale blockage - successfully removed via chemical/mechanical intervention
downholeEquipment.remediationMethod: 48hr DTPA chemical soak + high-pressure CT jetting
downholeEquipment.productionImpact: Was blocking production - now fully cleared

events.summary: Initial well completion
Initial rate: 6,800 bopd condensate, 35 MMscfd gas
Routine water analysis detected elevated Barium (450 ppm) and Sulfate (1200 ppm) levels
events.keyFindings: Commingling of injected seawater and formation water creating BaSO4 scale risk

events.summary: CRITICAL: PLT toolstring unable to pass 9,200ft due to hard obstruction
events.anomalyDetected: Solid blockage - suspected BaSO4 scale bridge
events.followUpAction: Chemical analysis of water confirms BaSO4. Plan chemical/mechanical removal.

events.summary: Emergency bullhead of scale inhibitor to prevent further deposition
Spotted 850 gallons of DTPA dissolver across scale bridge. 48hr soak period.
events.keyFindings: DTPA successfully softened BaSO4 scale after 48hr soak

events.summary: SUCCESS: High-pressure rotating jetting tool removed softened scale. Full access restored.
events.keyFindings: Scale successfully removed. Circulated out ~2.5 bbls of scale debris. Full passage confirmed.

events.summary: PLT re-run to 10,800ft - full passage confirmed, no restrictions
events.keyFindings: No restrictions. Scale fully removed.

events.summary: Well returned to production. Production: 6,500 bopd, 34 MMscfd gas - full restoration
events.keyFindings: Production fully restored. Continuous scale inhibitor injection program implemented.

testingHistory.keyFindings: PLT toolstring passed to TD without restriction

resolvedAnomalies.description: Hard barium sulfate scale bridge at 9,200ft MD
resolvedAnomalies.remediationAction: 48hr DTPA soak followed by high-pressure CT jetting
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: Two-stage chemical/mechanical approach is proven method for hard BaSO4 scale. Avoid aggressive milling (stuck pipe risk).

riskFactors.mitigation: Continuous scale inhibitor injection program active

managementOfChangeLog.title: S-15 Scale Removal Campaign
managementOfChangeLog.reason: BaSO4 scale blockage requires chemical/mechanical intervention

downholeEquipment.itemType: TRSSV (Tubing Retrievable Subsurface Safety Valve) - LOCKED OPEN
downholeEquipment.notes: Failed during routine test. Mechanically locked open on 2024-03-19.

downholeEquipment.itemType: WRSV (Wireline Retrievable Safety Valve) - Insert Valve
downholeEquipment.notes: New insert valve installed inside locked-open failed TRSSV

events.summary: Initial well completion
Initial rate: 4,200 bopd condensate, 22 MMscfd gas
CRITICAL FAILURE: TRSSV failed to close reliably during routine 6-month test
events.outcome: FAILED - Valve did not close reliably
events.anomalyDetected: TRSSV failed to close on control line bleed-down. Multiple attempts unsuccessful.
events.followUpAction: Well mandatorily shut-in by regulatory authority pending repair

events.summary: Well shut-in by NSTA order - primary safety barrier non-functional
events.keyFindings: Production suspended until primary barrier restored

events.summary: Mechanical lock-open tool successfully deployed on failed TRSSV
events.keyFindings: Failed TRSSV mechanically locked in open position. Ready for insert valve installation.

events.summary: SUCCESS: New wireline-retrievable insert valve installed and tested - primary barrier restored
events.keyFindings: WRSV successfully set and tested. Full function test passed. Well compliant for production.

events.summary: Well returned to production after 32 days shut-in. Production: 4,100 bopd, 21 MMscfd gas
events.keyFindings: Full production restored. NSTA compliance achieved.

testingHistory.failureMode: Valve did not close on control line bleed-down

testingHistory.acceptanceCriteria: Valve closes on control line pressure loss, holds differential pressure
testingHistory.keyFindings: New WRSV fully functional. Primary barrier restored.

resolvedAnomalies.description: TRSSV failed to close during function test
resolvedAnomalies.remediationAction: Locked open failed TRSSV and installed new WRSV insert valve
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: Mechanical lock-open tool is more reliable than hydraulic methods. Insert valve is proven cost-effective alternative to full TRSSV replacement.

managementOfChangeLog.title: F-11 DHSV Replacement Campaign
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Failed TRSSV requires replacement to restore primary barrier

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Primary DHSV Barrier Failure - F-11
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Immediate notification of TRSSV failure. Well shut-in on secondary barriers.

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Primary Barrier Restored - F-11 Return to Production
regulatoryNotifications.summary: WRSV successfully installed. Well compliant and returned to production.

downholeEquipment.failureMode: Screen erosion due to high sand production rates
downholeEquipment.repairMethod: Expandable sand screen patch installed through tubing

downholeEquipment.function: Restore sand control across failed screen section

perforations.notes: High sand production potential - requires sand control

wellheadAndTree.notes: Surface choke replaced 3 times in 6 months (pre-patch) due to sand erosion

events.summary: Initial well completion with standalone sand screen
Initial rate: 3,800 bopd condensate, 19 MMscfd gas. Minimal sand production.
Replaced production choke due to severe erosional wear from sand
events.keyFindings: Sand content in production fluid elevated to 50 ppm

events.summary: Second choke replacement in 3 months - severe sand erosion
events.keyFindings: Sand content now 200 ppm. Choking back well to reduce rates.

events.summary: Third choke replacement in 6 months - critical sand control failure
events.keyFindings: Sand content 500+ ppm. Production choked to 40% capacity. Downhole video survey ordered.

events.summary: CRITICAL DISCOVERY: Video confirms severe erosion of sand screen at 9,850ft
events.keyFindings: Multiple holes visible in wire-wrapped screen. Screen completely eroded in 3ft section.

events.summary: Wellbore cleanout and gauge ring run to verify patch deployment envelope
events.keyFindings: Wellbore cleaned. No restrictions. Ready for patch deployment.

events.eventType: Through-Tubing Expandable Sand Screen Patch Installation
events.summary: SUCCESS: Expandable sand screen patch installed across failed section - sand control restored
events.keyFindings: Patch successfully expanded across failed screen section. Sand production eliminated.

events.summary: Well slowly brought back online - monitoring sand production
events.keyFindings: Production ramped to 80% capacity. Sand content <5 ppm. Patch performing perfectly.

events.summary: Well returned to full production capacity. Sand-free production achieved.
events.keyFindings: Production: 3,600 bopd, 18 MMscfd gas. Sand content <2 ppm. No choke erosion.

events.summary: Review confirms patch integrity and continued sand-free production
events.keyFindings: Zero sand production issues since patch installation. No choke replacements required.

dataLogRepository.keyFindings: Severe erosion of sand screen - multiple holes visible

resolvedAnomalies.description: Failed sand screen causing severe sand production and surface equipment erosion
resolvedAnomalies.remediationAction: Installed expandable sand screen patch across failed section
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: Through-tubing expandable sand screen patch is viable rigless solution for sand control failures. Eliminates costly workover.

managementOfChangeLog.title: C-08 Sand Screen Patch Installation
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Failed sand screen requires through-tubing patch to restore sand control

downholeEquipment.description: Severe paraffin wax blockage - successfully removed via chemical/mechanical intervention
downholeEquipment.remediationMethod: Heated chemical dissolver + mechanical scraper tool on CT
downholeEquipment.productionImpact: Was completely blocking production - now fully cleared

events.summary: Initial well completion
Initial rate: 2,400 bopd oil, low GOR well
Production declined from 2,200 to 1,400 bopd over 3 months. Temperature analysis suggests wax deposition.
events.keyFindings: Wellhead temperature dropped from 145°F to 125°F. Wax precipitation probable.

events.summary: CRITICAL: Gauge ring tagged soft, waxy obstruction at 6,000ft. Unable to pass.

events.eventType: CT Chemical Treatment - Heated Paraffin Dissolver
events.summary: Injected 650 gallons heated paraffin dissolver. 24hr soak period.
events.keyFindings: Heated dissolver (180°F) successfully softened paraffin after 24hr soak

events.eventType: CT Mechanical Wax Removal - Scraper Run
events.summary: SUCCESS: Mechanical wax scraper tool removed softened wax. Full access restored.
events.keyFindings: Wax successfully removed. Circulated out ~4 bbls of wax debris. Full passage to 7300ft confirmed.

events.summary: Gauge ring re-run to 7,300ft - full passage confirmed, no restrictions
events.keyFindings: No wax restrictions detected. Wellbore clear.

events.summary: Well returned to production. Production rate restored to 2,150 bopd - 54% increase over pre-treatment
events.keyFindings: Production fully restored. Wax inhibitor injection program implemented to prevent reformation.

resolvedAnomalies.description: Severe paraffin wax blockage at 6,000ft MD
resolvedAnomalies.remediationAction: Heated chemical dissolver + mechanical scraper on CT
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: Dual chemical/mechanical approach highly effective for severe paraffin. Heated dissolver critical for success. Continuous wax inhibitor injection prevents recurrence.

masterAssetRegister.description: Continuous wax inhibitor injection umbilical system

managementOfChangeLog.title: P-12 Wax Removal Campaign
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Paraffin wax blockage requires chemical/mechanical intervention

deformationDetails.restrictionSeverity: Was unable to pass full toolstrings - NOW RESTORED

downholeEquipment.function: Restore full-bore access across casing deformation

events.summary: Initial HPHT well completion
Initial rate: 12,500 bopd oil, 8 MMscfd gas
Production declined to 4,200 bopd. Multiple potential issues identified.
events.keyFindings: Four compound issues identified: (1) Partial casing restriction at 9,200ft, (2) Minor scale buildup, (3) Aging SSSV showing intermittent issues, (4) Intermittent sand production damaging chokes.

events.summary: Cross-functional team develops comprehensive campaign to address all issues simultaneously
events.keyFindings: Decision: Execute all remediation in single integrated campaign. Estimated 45 days saved vs. sequential approach.

events.summary: SUCCESS: 40ft expandable patch installed across casing restriction
events.keyFindings: Patch expanded to 8.45" ID. Pressure tested to 12,000 psi. Full access confirmed.

events.summary: SUCCESS: Scale dissolved using DTPA chemical treatment
events.keyFindings: Minor scale deposits successfully removed. Wellbore clean.

events.summary: SUCCESS: Failed SSSV locked open and new WRSV insert valve installed
events.keyFindings: Failed SSSV mechanically locked open. New WRSV installed and tested. Full barrier integrity confirmed.

events.summary: SUCCESS: Premium sand screen assembly installed through tubing
events.keyFindings: Sand screen successfully installed and expanded. Zero sand production observed.

events.summary: Comprehensive verification confirms all objectives achieved
events.keyFindings: Full wellbore access confirmed. No scale. DHSV operational. Zero sand. All objectives met.

events.summary: Well returned to production - EXCEEDED all expectations
events.keyFindings: EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE: Production jumped to 11,800 bopd (vs 4,200 bopd pre-intervention = 180% improvement). Zero NPT. Full barrier integrity. Zero sand production. Campaign SUCCESS.

dataLogRepository.keyFindings: Uniform production profile across perforations. Zero sand.

resolvedAnomalies.description: Four simultaneous issues: casing restriction, scale, failed SSSV, sand production
resolvedAnomalies.remediationAction: Four-stage integrated campaign: patch, scale treatment, DHSV replacement, sand control
resolvedAnomalies.lessonsLearned: CRITICAL SUCCESS STORY: Integrated multi-discipline approach saved 45 days vs sequential interventions. Comprehensive planning and execution of multiple remediation strategies simultaneously is highly effective. This blueprint directly informed W666 intervention strategy.

riskFactors.mitigation: Comprehensive intervention successful. Well performing at peak capacity.

managementOfChangeLog.title: S-77 Integrated Multi-Stage Intervention Campaign
managementOfChangeLog.reason: Multiple compound failures require comprehensive integrated intervention
managementOfChangeLog.riskAssessment: HIGH COMPLEXITY - Multi-discipline integrated approach in HPHT deepwater environment

mitigations: All equipment certified and pressure tested

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Multi-Stage Intervention Program Submission - S-77
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Submission of comprehensive integrated intervention program for NSTA review

regulatoryNotifications.subject: Exceptional Campaign Success - S-77 Performance Results
regulatoryNotifications.summary: Reporting exceptional campaign results. 180% production increase. Zero NPT. Full barrier integrity restored.

awards: 2023 BP Best Practice Award - Integrated Well Intervention
NSTA Industry Excellence Award - Well Integrity Management 2023

industryPresentation.title: Integrated Multi-Stage Intervention: A Blueprint for Complex Well Rehabilitation
